Dear Melanie Williams:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the action steps will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at.
P.O. BOX 30650 • LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov • (517) 335-1980

Sincerely,

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CPA Rule 400.12419 Initial Services Plans
Section (1) The initial service plan, as required in R 400.12418(2)(a), shall
Description include all of the following information:
(e) A plan that has as its goal reunification of the child with his or
her family or another goal of permanent placement. The plan shall
include all of the following information:
(iii) Action steps and time frames to achieve the necessary
conditions identified in paragraph (ii) of this subdivision.
1

Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Agency did not provide therapy, trauma assessments, and
complete a guardianship as recommended.
Investigation I interviewed Complainant 1 by telephone on 3/06/2023.
Complainant 1 stated Sibling Group 1 had been in care 3-4 years
and the relative caregiver has recently requested removal of the
children. Complainant 1 reported no therapy and trauma
assessments have been provided and a guardianship has not yet
been established.
I reviewed 5 Updated Service Plans (USP's) and 4 Parent Agency
Treatment Plans (PATP's). The service plans and Parent Agency
Agreements indicated assessments of needs/strengths were
being completed along with action steps/expectations of how
identified problems were to be resolved. However there appeared
to be a lack of follow up in monitoring the referrals for services that
were made to confirm the services were being provided to resolve
the identified barriers. A significant part of the permanency
planning goal for this group of siblings was the goal of establishing
a guardianship with the relative caregiver of this sibling group.
USP's and PATP's from 2/28/2022 to 02/15/2023 were reviewed.
They indicated that the mother of this sibling group was
permanently disabled, terminally ill, and unable to care for the
children but she was unwilling to agree to the establishment of a
guardianship for the children. The mother had
received/completed a psychological evaluation, but she refused to
follow the recommendations of both her physical and mental
health care providers. A court hearing 8/2/2022 indicated the
guardianship was pending but a home study, fingerprinting, and
assistance programs/clearances were needed to be completed
and submitted to the court for approval. A court hearing
1/17/2023 reported the action steps necessary for the
establishment of a guardianship had not yet been completed.
I interviewed Administrator 1 by telephone on 5/4/2023.
Administrator 1 stated this sibling group case has been transferred
to another office of the agency. Administrator 1 stated the agency
is having a difficult time to be adequately staffed and the changes
in caseworkers contributed to the lack of follow up regarding the
services in this case.
My review of the information record identified at least 3 different
caseworkers for this case from 2/17/22 to 2/3/23.
2

Analysis The findings of this investigation determined the agency identified
areas of needs and services to address those needs. The records
also indicated referrals for some services were made but there
was a lack of follow up to ensure the services were being provided
as needed. Compliance with this rule implies there is follow up to
ensure services are being utilized consistent with the established
goal/assessments.
Conclusion Violation Established
